title: Madueke defends Arsenal fans‚Äô right to be excited
description: Noni Madueke thinks Arsenal fans are right to be excited about the current campaign, with the team still competing on four fronts.Photo by James Fearn/Getty ImagesThough Arsenal haven‚Äôt won anything...
fullText:
Though Arsenal haven‚Äôt won anything yet, the Gunners continue to be in contention for trophies in every competition they‚Äôve participated in this season.

Mikel Arteta‚Äôs side are four points clear at the top of the Premier League, they‚Äôre in the Champions League round-of-16 after finishing top of the League Phase, they‚Äôre in the League Cup final, and Sunday‚Äôs 4-0 win over Wigan has them in the FA Cup last-16 as well.

It could still all fall apart, but Arsenal will at least go into March knowing that every trophy is still a possibility.

Speaking following the win over Wigan, Noni Madueke answered a question in which the reporter suggested Arsenal fans would be getting excited about how the season may end.

‚ÄúYeah, for sure, I think they have every right to be,‚Äù Madueke told TNT Sports. ‚ÄúWe‚Äôre working hard to try to deliver the type of season that I think it ought to be, with the way we‚Äôre performing right now.

‚ÄúSo that‚Äôs our main focus, and yeah, I think it‚Äôs exciting. But we need to carry on just doing the right things every single day, and see where we are at the end.‚Äù

For the time being, Arsenal‚Äôs focus will turn back to the Premier League, with the two games remaining this month being away trips to Wolves and Spurs.

Thanks to Arsenal‚Äôs Champions League top-eight finish, the team will then get a rare midweek off before facing Chelsea on March 1st. The FA Cup fifth round (March 7th-8th), the Champions League last-16 (March 10th-18th), and the League Cup final (March 22nd) all take place later in the month.

The hope is that Arsenal will then still be competing on three fronts in April, with one trophy already in the bag.

title: Proposed blockbuster Dodgers trade sees Los Angeles land $100 million two-time All-Star, DPOY to complete superstar outfield with Teoscar Hernandez, Kyle Tucker
description: This would give the Dodgers undoubtedly the best outfield in the MLB.
fullText:
Proposed blockbuster Dodgers trade sees Los Angeles land $100 million two-time All-Star, DPOY to complete superstar outfield with Teoscar Hernandez, Kyle Tucker originally appeared on The Sporting News. Add The Sporting News as a Preferred Source by clicking here.

The Los Angeles Dodgers have been one of the most active teams in the offseason, to no one‚Äôs surprise. Now, with the offseason winding down, they could make one more move to make sure they are guaranteed to three-peat.

According to Fansided‚Äôs Mark Powell and Wynston Wilcox, that move is trading for Minnesota Twins two-time All-Star and Wilson Overall Defensive Player of the Year Byron Buxton. Buxton would anchor the outfield, and provide another All-Star bat to their lineup.

MORE:¬†Proposed blockbuster Padres trade sees San Diego land $330 million two-time MVP, would be massive upgrade from Gavin Sheets

‚ÄúWhat big-named player isn't going to have the interest of the LA Dodgers, right? They could use an upgrade on the corners in the outfield so this makes sense. And if you want to stay atop of MLB, the best way to do it is to have a bulletproof lineup. Adding Buxton just improves the bottom of their order. The only dangerous team is one that has a reputable batter, one through nine,‚Äù Powell and Wilcox wrote.

This past season, Buxton slashed .264/.327/.551/.878 with 21 doubles, 35 home runs, and 83 RBI in 126 games played. He would replace Andy Pages in the outfield, and would bring more power and a better glove as well.

MORE:¬†Proposed blockbuster Yankees trade sees New York land $330 million two-time MVP to create superstar outfield trio with Aaron Judge, Cody Bellinger

He‚Äôs also incredibly cheap by the Dodgers‚Äô standards. He's only set to make around $45 million over the final three years of his contract.

With time running out, the Dodgers better consider this trade soon before someone else does.

title: Nate Diaz adds Conor McGregor to three-man list for upcoming bout
description: Nate Diaz says he is ready to finally settle his long-standing rivalry with Conor McGregor. Diaz has not fought in the UFC since 2022, back when Francis Ngannou still held the heavyweight belt.
fullText:
Nate Diaz says he is ready to finally settle his long-standing rivalry with Conor McGregor.

Diaz has not fought in the UFC since 2022, back when Francis Ngannou still held the heavyweight belt. But unlike Ngannou, Diaz did not burn any bridges on his way out.

Dana White left the door open for him to return, and now, after stints boxing Jake Paul and Jorge Masvidal, the 40-year-old appears interested in coming back.

This past week, Diaz made it known that he wants to return at the UFC White House event set for June.

Initially, the former UFC star said he would like to face the winner of the UFC 326 BMF title fight between Max Holloway and Charles Oliveira, predicting that ‚ÄòBlessed‚Äô would come out on top.

Now, just a week after those comments, Diaz has laid out a new hit list of three names ‚Äì starting with the long-awaited trilogy against Conor McGregor.

He told TMZ Sports: ‚ÄúI would like to fight somebody, I‚Äôm ready to get back into real action, I want to fight either McGregor (trilogy), I want to fight maybe Dustin Poirier if he stops being such a p‚Äî- and then maybe Mike Perry, we‚Äôll see what happens in the future, though.‚Äù

Fans have clamoured for a decisive third fight between Diaz and McGregor since their UFC 202 rematch in 2016, which left their series tied at 1-1.

And interest in that potential third meeting was reignited recently when Dana White dismissed talks of a McGregor vs Michael Chandler bout at the upcoming UFC event.

An ongoing feud has persisted between Diaz and Dustin Poirier for years. Even with ‚ÄòThe Diamond‚Äôs‚Äô recent retirement, it appeared he would still consider returning for a fight against the Stockton fighter.

On the other hand, a match-up with Mike Perry would likely fall under BKFC rules ‚Äì but it is doubtful that Diaz would make a move into bare-knuckle fighting.

Diaz, despite being 40 years old and having passed his fighting prime, consistently remained one of the most popular fighters on the UFC roster.

He also had a strong relationship with Dana White, even though he and his brother Nick have had their share of differences with the UFC boss over the years.

When Diaz left the promotion in 2022, White said it would ‚Äòalways‚Äô be Nate‚Äôs house. He never completely ruled out a potential return to bring him back onto the roster.

title: Illinois falls to No. 10 in latest AP poll after 1-1 week
description: Four weeks until the tourney.
fullText:
A so-so week for the Illini, and they now find themselves at No. 10 in the latest AP poll on Monday.

Illinois checked in last week at No. 8, and proceeded to lose to Wisconsin at State Farm Center. But the Illini ‚Äî with Kylan Boswell back on the court ‚Äî turned things around with a 20-point win over Indiana on Sunday.

Only gets more challenging for the Illini now, as they travel west for the week. First up is USC on Wednesday before a showdown with UCLA on Saturday.

And looming is that matchup with now-No. 1 Michigan. Illinois still has a chance for a Big Ten regular season title, but they‚Äôll need to beat the Wolverines and see them lose at least one other game.

A ‚Äútriple‚Äù-bye in the conference tournament is still at play. A reminder: All 18 teams are making it this year, so the tourney starts on Tuesday, March 10.

title: Defending champion Sweden pushed to brink of elimination from Olympic men's curling
description: CORTINA D'AMPEZZO, Italy (AP) ‚Äî Defending men's curling gold medalist Sweden was pushed to the brink of elimination from the Milan Cortina Olympics on Tuesday with a 7-3 loss to Germany.  The loss was Sweden's fifth in six games of round-robin play, putting the curling powerhouse at the bottom of the standings along with Czechia and China and likely out of semifinal contention.  The Swedish men won gold in Beijing in 2022 and silver in Pyeongchang four years earlier.
fullText:
CORTINA D'AMPEZZO, Italy (AP) ‚Äî Defending men's curling gold medalist Sweden was pushed to the brink of elimination from the Milan Cortina Olympics on Tuesday with a 7-3 loss to Germany.

The loss was Sweden's fifth in six games of round-robin play, putting the curling powerhouse at the bottom of the standings along with Czechia and China and likely out of semifinal contention.

The Swedish men won gold in Beijing in 2022 and silver in Pyeongchang four years earlier. Sweden also won gold in mixed doubles at these Olympics, beating the United States.

‚ÄúWe just didn‚Äôt get up to our best level this tournament, and to be in the playoff in this tournament you have to be on your best level,‚Äù said Rasmus Wran√•, the mixed doubles champion with his sister, Isabella Wran√•.

Sweden ignited a controversy during its loss to Canada when Oskar Eriksson accused Canadian Marc Kennedy of breaking the rules by double-touching. The Swedes also lost to Italy, Britain and the U.S. while beating China.

Kennedy reacted angrily to Eriksson's accusation, and World Curling temporarily ramped up official monitoring of matches. On Sunday, the federation scaled that back.

Wran√• and Eriksson said the kerfuffle was not to blame for the team's struggles. Against Germany, the Swedes were ‚Äújust making too many half shots and a few mistakes here and there,‚Äù Eriksson said.

Eriksson had no regrets about raising the issue of double-touching and was happy with the way World Curling handled the situation.

‚ÄúFor us, it‚Äôs been a problem the last couple of years,‚Äù he said. ‚ÄúSo we think it‚Äôs good that everyone can play with the same rules.

‚ÄúHopefully it‚Äôs just getting better from this,‚Äù he said.

AP Winter Olympics: https://apnews.com/hub/milan-cortina-2026-winter-olympics

title: Bremen defender a doubt for upcoming relegation clash with St. Pauli
description: Fears have heightened in Werder Bremen's camp that Karim Coulibaly could be a doubt for next Sunday's trip to FC St. Pauli.¬†The 18-year-old was forced to limp off shortly after the hour mark during h...
fullText:
Fears have heightened in Werder Bremen's camp that Karim Coulibaly could be a doubt for next Sunday's trip to FC St. Pauli.

The 18-year-old was forced to limp off shortly after the hour mark during his side's 3-0 defeat to Bayern Munich last Saturday.

Now, according to Kicker.de, the central defender has been diagnosed with a ‚Äústructural muscle injury in his thigh‚Äù.

Bremen's team doctor Philip Heitmann conducted the MRI scan on the German talent this afternoon and came to the conclusion.

Head coach Daniel Thioune said Coulibaly will be assessed ‚Äúday by day‚Äù but labelled his involvement as ‚Äúdefinitely questionable‚Äù.

With Bremen only two points ahead of St. Pauli who are sat in 17th-place in the relegation zone, every player could prove vital next weekend.

title: Harry Brook makes baffling claim after England survive T20 World Cup scare vs Italy
description: England narrowly avoided a disaster in their final T20 World Cup group match against Italy on Monday. Harry Brook won the toss and controversially decided to bat first at Eden Gardens in Kolkata.
fullText:
England narrowly avoided a disaster in their final T20 World Cup group match against Italy on Monday.

Harry Brook won the toss and controversially decided to bat first at Eden Gardens in Kolkata.

England were 105/5 after a shaky opening 13 overs before Will Jacks rescued the innings with an unbeaten 53 from 22 balls.

Italy then battled back from 22/3 to 135/4 in their run chase, making the England players and fans nervous.

However, the Italians ultimately collapsed to 178 all out, and the Three Lions qualified for the Super 8s.

Brook made an interesting comment about England‚Äôs performance in his post-match interview, which many will disagree with.

Harry Brook has every reason to be pleased with his team‚Äôs progression into the last eight of the competition.

However, it would be foolish to suggest that England‚Äôs performance against Italy was anything to be proud of.

Italy are the 26th-ranked team in the ICC T20I Team Rankings, so it should never have been a close contest.

That is why it was so surprising to hear Brook‚Äôs claim that England bowled well on Monday.

‚ÄúI thought we fielded excellently, and we bowled nicely as well,‚Äù he said. ‚ÄúI never had a doubt at the end with Sam [Curran] and Jamie [Overton]. Sam has been awesome, and he has been throughout this comp so far.

‚ÄúWhen Jof is on a heater, you want to get as much out of as possible ‚Äì he did that today in his first couple of overs.‚Äù

Without question, England will need to bowl much better in the next stage of the tournament if they want to make the semi-finals.

While Brook praised England‚Äôs bowlers, he did recognise that their batting unit must improve quickly.

‚ÄúWe haven‚Äôt played our best cricket,‚Äù he added. ‚ÄúAt the end of the day, we have made it through, and we‚Äôre heading to Sri Lanka, so we can be happy about that.

‚ÄúA little bit of a trend in this competition. We have not managed to string along the score as we like to do as a batting unit. We have got to keep on being brave and taking our options.‚Äù

202 would normally be an excellent T20 score, but England would have hoped for at least 220 against cricket minnows Italy.

title: Men's college basketball rankings after Week 15: Updated Coaches Poll, AP Top 25
description: After a chaotic week that saw No. 1 Arizona drop two games, here's a look at the new college basketball polls with a new No. 1.
fullText:
A new No. 1-ranked team was crowned in the latest USA TODAY Sports Men's Basketball Coaches Poll after Arizona suffered its first two losses in back-to-back fashion against Kansas and Texas Tech last week.

Michigan (24-1) took over the top spot in the poll on Monday, Feb. 16, and has won 10 consecutive games since dropping its only game this season against Wisconsin on Jan. 10. Nine of its wins during the win streak have been by double digits, outside of its 75-72 win over No. 9 Nebraska.

REQUIRED READING: March Sadness: College basketball's 10 most disappointing teams

Arizona not only fell out of the No. 1 ranking, but fell behind Michigan, No. 3 Houston and No. 4 Duke after its back-to-back-losses. Elsewhere, Purdue jumped five spots to No. 7 in the update, ahead of the Boilermakers' top 10 showdown against No. 1 Michigan on Feb. 17.

title: BYU Remains in AP Poll, but Drops after Richie Saunders Injury
description: The latest AP Poll was released Monday and BYU fell one spot from 22 to 23. BYU had wins over Baylor and Colorado, but the Richie Saunders injury likely impacted some voters‚Äô placement of BYU on their ballots. BYU is one of six Big 12 teams ranked along with Houston (2), Arizona (4), Iowa State [‚Ä¶]
fullText:
The latest AP Poll was released Monday and BYU fell one spot from 22 to 23. BYU had wins over Baylor and Colorado, but the Richie Saunders injury likely impacted some voters‚Äô placement of BYU on their ballots.

BYU is one of six Big 12 teams ranked along with Houston (2), Arizona (4), Iowa State (6), Kansas (8), and Texas Tech (13). Wisconsin also entered the AP Poll at #24; BYU beat the Badgers in Salt Lake City back in November.

BYU has arguably its toughest week of the season this week when they travel to Tucson to play #4 Arizona Wednesday and host #6 Iowa State Saturday. Arizona may be down a couple rotation players, but the loss of Richie Saunders will make even a split in those two games difficult. If BYU were able to get a split, they would get their first Quad 1A win of the season and show to the committee that they can compete with elite teams even without Saunders.

title: Updating Lady Vols' ranking in college basketball polls after Texas loss
description: Lady Vols basketball moved up in the Associated Press poll on Feb. 16 after losing by two points to Texas. Tennessee has four more ranked matchups.
fullText:
Lady Vols basketball moved up a spot in the Associated Press poll after going 1-1 in SEC play last week.

Tennessee (16-7, 8-3 SEC) was ranked No. 21 in the AP Top 25 on Feb. 16 after a 45-point win over Missouri and a 65-63 loss to No. 4 Texas. The Lady Vols were ranked No. 22 in both the AP poll and USA TODAY coaches poll last week.

Tennessee is back in action right away with a road matchup against No. 16 Ole Miss (20-6, 7-4) on Feb. 17 (7 p.m. ET, ESPNU). The game was originally scheduled for Jan. 26 before icy conditions in Oxford, Mississippi, postponed the matchup.

The Lady Vols will also face Texas A&M at home on Feb. 19 before playing No. 10 Oklahoma on the road Feb. 22.

Tennessee started the season as a consensus top-10 team, ranked No. 9 in the coaches preseason poll and No. 8 in the AP preseason poll. It fell out of the top 10 after losing the season opener to NC State and dropped to No. 12 in both polls after starting 2-1.

UT had its biggest drop in the polls after its losses to UCLA, Louisville and South Carolina. It fell six spots in the coaches poll and five spots in the AP poll after losing to the Bruins, and it fell six spots in the AP Top 25 after losing to Louisville. The Lady Vols fell five spots in the USA TODAY coaches poll after the loss to the Gamecocks.

Tennessee ended the 2024-25 season ranked No. 16 in the coaches poll and No. 15 in the AP poll after starting Kim Caldwell's first season at the helm unranked. UT was ranked as high as No. 11 last season, though it never cracked the top 10.

The Lady Vols have been ranked in the AP Top 25 the most of any program since the poll began in 1976. UT has been ranked in 809 of the 900 polls.

title: Tandy 'needs help' - Wales' hunt for defence coach
description: Wales needs a specialist defence coach but Welsh rugby greats Sam Warburton and Alun Wyn Jones question when that will happen and who decides.
fullText:
Steve Tandy needs help. As head coach of a crisis-ridden Wales side plunging to new depths every time they take to the field, that much is obvious.

Specifically, according to two Welsh rugby greats, Tandy needs the support of a full-time defence coach.

His work as defence coach for Scotland impressed enough to earn the same role with the British and Irish Lions, so Tandy was expected to tighten things up for Wales when he took the reins last September.

Yet their has been little case for the defence with Wales.

In his first six games in charge - albeit including the world's top four teams in their last four Tests - Tandy's Wales have conceded a staggering 302 points and 42 tries.

The latest battering, Sunday's 54-12 mauling by France in Cardiff, leaves Wales bottom of the Six Nations having already shipped 102 points. No team has conceded 

Tandy has confirmed Wales will have a specialist defence coach by the summer but the timing of that appointment - and who makes it - has been questioned.

Wales cling to optimism despite another record loss

Lowest Cardiff Six Nations crowd amid rugby turmoil

Scotland game chance for Wales to 'deliver better'

Wales have full-time attack and forwards coaches in the form of Matt Sherratt and Danny Wilson, but Tandy only has the temporary support of Dan Lydiate ‚Äì still very early in his coaching career ‚Äì in defence.

Juggling that work with his head coach duties, Tandy might be spreading himself too thinly, according to former Wales captains Sam Warburton and Alun Wyn Jones.

"Mid-season it's hard to transition and get someone in," Tandy told BBC Sport.

"It's something we're working hard to have a look at and, probably by the summer, we'll have an option then.

"It isn't a quick fix. It's something we need to layer and build towards the future."

Warburton won two Six Nations titles, including a Grand Slam, with a Wales team built on the rock-solid defensive foundation provided by Shaun Edwards, who now holds that role for France.

The former Wales captain said Tandy needs help with defence.

"Steve's admitted he's probably spread himself a bit too thinly," Warburton told BBC Sport.

"He's been doing the defence with Dan Lydiate but then you're trying to do the defence with all the other things that come with being a head coach.

"Dan is more the micro defensive skills [such as] tackle technique, competition on the floor.

"Wales don't have a full-time defence coach [and] it's not just about being a coach during campaign time. When the players are playing for their clubs, you're there full-time, watching the regions play, or the Welsh-qualified players playing in England, and you can still keep dialogue and send clips.

"He needs to bring in a defence coach [but] it sounds like they can't get people out of their contracts because it's difficult to bring people in mid-season.

"For someone to come in as a full-time defence coach, they need to be tried and tested at this level."

When taking his role as Welsh Rugby Union's director of rugby last July, Dave Reddin said Tandy would "not solely select" his coaching team but would be involved in the process.

He added: "It's about getting the right people in those spots as opposed to just getting the next people. It might well be that people are in position already and we need to be a bit more patient."

Whoever that new appointment might be, Alun Wyn Jones believes his former Ospreys team-mate Tandy should have the biggest say in the matter.

"Steve needs to be able to oversee everything and get others to focus on those areas," he said.

"The bigger question I'd ask: Is he going to appoint his own defence coach?

"There have been questions around that, as opposed to other people in the organisation. That's the most important thing ‚Äì he's got to be able to pick his own staff.

"He's got a great grip of the defence, but you can't spread yourself too thinly in that position."

title: What's next for Tua Tagovailoa as Dolphins begin round of cuts?
description: It sure seems like Tua Tagovailoa isn't long for Miami as the Dolphins start cleaning house.
fullText:
If you're reading this, then there's a good chance the new-look Miami Dolphins also released you from their roster on Monday.

OK, obviously not really. You don't play in the NFL. Still, the Dolphins were quite busy cleaning up some perceived dead weight on their roster. For one, perennial All-Pro receiver Tyreek Hill was released as he recovers from a knee injury. He's probably going to find a new NFL home soon enough; it just won't be in Southern Florida. So was high-priced pass-rusher, Bradley Chubb.

Hill's release, in particular, raises an interesting, more pertinent question for first-year head coach Jeff Hafley and company. What's quarterback Tua Tagovailoa's future in Miami? Are the rebuilding/retooling Dolphins willing to stick it out at least one more season with a quarterback who has proven he's not good enough? Or do they want to cut bait right now and simply get on with their lives?

According to Jordan Schultz, it sounds like Tagovailoa has likely played his last snap for the Dolphins, one way or another. If they can't find a trade partner for the veteran signal-caller, he will probably be released in short order before the 2026 NFL league year begins on Wednesday, March 11th.

The #Dolphins preference has been to find a trade partner for Tua Tagovailoa.

A cut is possible in the end. But that has been their preference.

My understanding is new regime doesn‚Äôt want it to drag too long. https://t.co/CC2KShHuvP

‚Äî Jordan Schultz (@Schultz_Report) February 16, 2026

Let's cut to the chase. I would be stunned if someone traded for Tagovailoa. The mere fact that he's being shopped has leaked to an insider of sorts tells me the Dolphins are having trouble finding suitors for the NFL's 11th-highest paid quarterback by total guaranteed money. It's clear no one wants to foot the bill for a quarterback whose smallest cap hit over the next three seasons will be $53.4 million, per Over The Cap. That's Patrick Mahomes and Josh Allen money, not mediocre quarterback money.

As such, news like this is usually the precursor to a player like Tagovailoa getting released soon after. Of course, that doesn't come without a cost. If the Dolphins release Tagovailoa before June 1st, they will incur $99.2 million in dead salary cap money. That's ... steep and restrictive to any possible team-building Miami might want to do this offseason. But it seems leadership is prepared to rip the Tagovailoa Band-Aid off now, rather than let him linger around the organization in a new era. The Dolphins aren't necessarily trying to be competitive in 2026. Tagovailoa's release would be a bold calculation with a long-term perspective.

Perhaps, that's what the Dolphins need more than anything after flirting with middling irrelevance for the past few seasons.

This article originally appeared on For The Win: Will Dolphins release Tua Tagovailoa? The latest after Miami cuts

title: üò¢ Cristiano Ronaldo often in tears? Former teammate spills the beans!
description: It is often read that superstar Cristiano Ronaldo is not always in control of his own emotions.¬†Now, a former teammate of the Portuguese superstar has spilled the beans and given insight into his emo...
fullText:
It is often read that superstar Cristiano Ronaldo is not always in control of his own emotions.

Now, a former teammate of the Portuguese superstar has spilled the beans and given insight into his emotional world.

Nani accompanied Ronaldo at the beginning of his world career at Sporting Lisbon. Later, the two were under contract together at Manchester United and played together in the Portuguese national team.

The 39-year-old is currently under contract with FK Aktobe in Kazakhstan and spoke in the magazine ‚ÄòFourFourTwo‚Äô about Ronaldo's occasional emotional outbursts.

According to him, Ronaldo stood out from the crowd as a child and knew exactly what he wanted: ‚ÄúCristiano lived football with immense passion. If he didn‚Äôt win or things didn‚Äôt go well, he cried,‚Äù Nani said.

This showed how committed he was and with what intensity he lived the game.

That the five-time world footballer has not yet stopped at 41 years old does not surprise the left winger. Rather, he is sure that his former teammate will still reach the 1000-goal mark in his career: ‚ÄúI have no doubt about that. It‚Äôs a milestone that is important to him and something he has had in mind for years,‚Äù said Nani.

According to ‚Äòtransfermarkt.de‚Äô, Ronaldo currently stands at 956 goals for his clubs and the Portuguese national team ‚Äì so only 44 more to go.

Sounds doable, right? What do you think: Will Cristiano Ronaldo reach this milestone? Feel free to write it in the comments.

This article was translated into English by Artificial Intelligence. You can read the original version in üá©üá™ here.

title: Where BYU‚Äôs 2-game win streak put the Cougars in the AP Top 25
description: Despite winning two straight games, BYU has fallen a spot in the national rankings.
fullText:
Despite winning two straight games, BYU has fallen a spot in the national rankings.

The Cougars came in at No. 23 in Monday‚Äôs latest AP Top 25 poll, their lowest mark of the year after landing at No. 7 in the preseason rankings.

BYU is the lowest-ranked Big 12 squad out of six ranked teams from the conference, joining No. 2 Houston, No. 4 Arizona, No. 6 Iowa State, No. 8 Kansas and No. 13 Texas Tech.

Michigan takes over as the NEW No. 1 in the AP Top 25 üî•

title: Deion Sanders' Atlanta homecoming opening date at Georgia Tech changed
description: Coach Prime and the Buffs will be featured in prime time.
fullText:
Deion Sanders' Atlanta homecoming opening date at Georgia Tech changed originally appeared on The Sporting News. Add The Sporting News as a Preferred Source by clicking here.

Deion Sanders and Colorado are heading back to prime time to open the 2026 season.

The Buffaloes‚Äô season opener at Georgia Tech has been moved to Thursday, Sept. 3, in Atlanta, the school announced Monday. Kickoff time will be announced later, but the game will be nationally televised on ESPN.

The move continues a recent trend under Sanders, whose program has become a regular in standalone windows. Colorado‚Äôs opener has now been shifted off a traditional Saturday for the third straight season and for the 12th time in the last 14 years. Last season‚Äôs opener against Georgia Tech at Folsom Field was played on a Friday night.

The Sept. 3 matchup marks the second game of a home-and-home series between the programs. Georgia Tech holds a 1-0 edge after a 27-20 win in Boulder last season. The Buffaloes will look to even the series in what will be just their second game played in the state of Georgia. Colorado previously faced Georgia in 2006.

More:Shedeur Sanders‚Äô jersey retirement was 'breaking point' for Colorado legend

The trip to Atlanta also carries added significance for Sanders, who starred there with the Atlanta Falcons and Atlanta Braves. On Oct. 11, 1992, he famously played in both an NFL and MLB game on the same day. Sanders was taken by the Falcons fifth overall in the 1989 NFL Draft.

Colorado‚Äôs home opener is scheduled for Sept. 12 against Weber State. The Buffaloes finished 3-9 in 2025, the worst record of Sanders‚Äô tenure.

title: MLB News: Steve Cohen Isn‚Äôt Scared of Dodgers‚Äô ‚ÄòFormidable‚Äô Spending
description: New York Mets owner Steve Cohen may have lost out on the Kyle Tucker sweepstakes, but he isn't backing down from spending big on high-level free agents.
fullText:
New York Mets owner Steve Cohen may have lost out on the Kyle Tucker sweepstakes, but he isn‚Äôt backing down from spending big on high-level free agents.

Anthony DiComo, Mets beat writer for MLB.com, quoted Cohen admitting the Los Angeles Dodgers have built a high-level franchise, but he indicated he‚Äôs not intimidated.

‚ÄúThey‚Äôre formidable,‚Äù DiComo shared on social media. ‚ÄúThey have the ability to spend. So do I, by the way.‚Äù

The Dodgers have taken some criticism in recent years over their spending to acquire big-name free agents like Shohei Ohtani and Tucker.

The $240 million contract for Tucker in particular has renewed interest in a possible salary cap in Major League Baseball, which is the only major North American sports league without one.

Cohen has admitted he wanted to sign Tucker this offseason and was ‚Äúannoyed‚Äù the team failed to land the prized outfielder.

The Mets also lost closer Edwin D√≠az to the Dodgers, though they were able to sign infielder Bo Bichette, whom the Dodgers had targeted.

In an interview with Mets broadcaster Howie Rose, Cohen has made the case that the team ultimately is better off with Bichette over Tucker.

‚ÄúFrankly, once it was all done, and we got Bo to come to the Mets, (I) actually feel Bo might be a better fit for the team,‚Äù said Cohen, as reported by Tim Britton for The Athletic. ‚ÄúSo I think things worked out for the best.‚Äù

While fans and owners of other teams might feel like the Dodgers are bad for baseball, current players ‚Äî even those who face off against the Boys in Blue regularly ‚Äî love what the team is doing.

‚ÄúI f‚Äîing love it,‚Äù San Diego Padre and former Dodger Manny Machado said of the Dodgers‚Äô spending. ‚ÄúEvery team should be doing it. ‚Ä¶S‚Äî is f‚Äîing great for the game. So I think every team has the ability to do it, so I hope all 30 teams can learn from that.‚Äù

Bryce Harper of the Philadelphia Phillies echoed that sentiment.

‚ÄúI love what the Dodgers do, obviously,‚Äù Harper said. ‚ÄúThey pay the money, they spend the money. I mean, they‚Äôre a great team. They understand how to run it. They run their team like a business, and they run it the right way. They understand where they need to put their money into.‚Äù

title: Back on top: Michigan basketball is again the No. 1 team in the nation
description: Michigan basketball is the last Power Four team with one loss and has won 10 straight to ascend to No. 1 team in the USA TODAY Sports Coaches Poll.
fullText:
There's a new No. 1 team in the nation.

Michigan basketball (24-1, 14-1 Big Ten) moved up one spot, to No. 1, in the USA TODAY Sports Coaches Poll on Monday, Feb. 16; the Wolverines were last atop the poll in its Jan. 5 iteration ‚àí five days before the Wolverines lost to Wisconsin in Ann Arbor, their only defeat this season.

Michigan has won 10 consecutive games since, nine by double figures. The Wolverines are coming off another sweep last week, knocking off Northwestern on the road and crushing UCLA at home; with previous No. 1 Arizona losing twice last week, U-M has now taken over the top spot with less than four weeks to play before the reveal of the 2026 March Madness bracket.

[ MUST WATCH: U-M's biggest week of the regular season is here. Make¬†"Hail Yes!"¬†your go-to Wolverines podcast, available anywhere you listen to podcasts (Apple,¬†Spotify). ]

Michigan has been ranked No. 1 for 38 games in its 108-year history.

This is the latest in a season Michigan has been ranked No. 1 since it was No. 1 in the Associated Press poll on March 7, 1977 in the final poll before the NCAA tournament. Soon after, the Wolverines were upset by Charlotte in the NCAA's second round.

Prior to that, Michigan hadn't been ranked No. 1 in February or later since 1965. That was the year consensus All-American Cazzie Russell led the Wolverines to the national championship game, which U-M lost to UCLA after holding onto the nation's top spot for more than three months.

Michigan State, which has lost three of its past four games, dropped to No. 15 in this week's coaches poll, down from No. 10 last week.

This season, Michigan has dominated on both sides of the ball. The Wolverines are No. 1 in defensive efficiency (88 points per 100 possessions) and average 2-point distance (7.1 feet), No. 2 in 2-point defense (42.8%) and effective field goal defense (43.2), No. 4 in block rate (18.7%) and No. 7 in 3-point defense (29.1%).

REQUIRED READING: How Michigan basketball built nation's biggest and best frontcourt

Offensively, the Wolverines are No. 2 in 2-point shooting (63%), No. 4 in efficiency (126.6), No. 7 in effective field goal percentage (58.9%), No. 7 in average possession length (15 seconds) and No. 24 in offensive rebounding rate (36.6%).

Michigan can't rest on its statistical excellence, however, with a tough slate this week: The Wolverines hit the road for a matchup with No. 7 Purdue on Tuesday (6:30 p.m., Peacock) before a neutral-court meeting with No. 3 Duke at Capital One Arena in Washington on Saturday (6:30 p.m., ESPN).

"It feels really good, but as you said, we have tough games now coming up," center Aday Mara said last week. "We got to focus on, on that, on our scout, on practicing, getting better. ... Our goal is not being No. 1 in the country ‚Äì our goal is to win everything."

Tony Garcia¬†is the¬†Wolverines¬†beat writer for the Detroit Free Press. Email him at apgarcia@freepress.com and follow him on X at¬†@RealTonyGarcia.

This article originally appeared on Detroit Free Press: Back on top: Michigan basketball is again the No. 1 team in the nation

title: U.S. Women's Hockey Surges Into Gold Medal Final At Winter Olympics
description: The Americans dominated Sweden in the semifinal and spread around the scoring.
fullText:
MILAN ‚Äï The United States beat Sweden 5-0 in the women‚Äôs ice hockey semi-finals on Monday to reach the Winter Olympics gold medal game.

The two-times champions were the favorites heading into Milan and they put on another convincing performance at Santagiulia arena, where Cayla Barnes scored in the first period, while Taylor Heise, Abbey Murphy, veteran Kendall Coyne Schofield and Hayley Scamurra notched second-period goals.

Sports: Norwegian Ski Superstar Makes Winter Olympics History With Record-Breaking Gold

They will play the winner of the semi-final between defending Olympic champions Canada and Switzerland for the gold on Thursday.

Sweden, who won their last medal with the silver in 2006, beat Czech Republic in the quarter-finals but ran out of firepower against the world champions United States.

title: Jose Mourinho gives clear response on Real Madrid return ‚Äì ‚ÄúOne of the few who left without being sacked‚Äô
description: Benfica manager Jose Mourinho has distanced himself from a return to the Bernabeu in the home dugout, as his side prepares to face Los Blancos in the Champions League play-off round. With no certainty...
fullText:
Benfica manager Jose Mourinho has distanced himself from a return to the Bernabeu in the home dugout, as his side prepares to face Los Blancos in the Champions League play-off round. With no certainty over the future of Alvaro Arbeloa beyond the summer, it has been suggested that Mourinho could potentially be in the running to return.

Arbeloa took over without a plethora of obvious candidates to replace Xabi Alonso. The name of Jurgen Klopp continues to come up, but the former Liverpool manager has also distanced himself from the job. President Florentino Perez has also held Mourinho in especially high regard too.

‚ÄúYes, you can,‚Äù Mourinho responded when asked if it was possible to say no to Real Madrid though, and went on to explain that he had not spoken to Perez since the start of the season.

‚ÄúThe last time was when I signed with Benfica. He told me he was very happy because I had signed for a great club. He didn‚Äôt come to the previous match; I hope he‚Äôll be here tomorrow and I can talk to him. We‚Äôre great friends,‚Äù he told Diario AS.

The Portuguese manager continued to sing the praises of all of those at the Bernabeu for the second time in the past month though. Even if he is able to get out of his current contract to join Real Madrid, Mourinho played down the idea.

‚ÄúI gave everything I had to Real Madrid. I did some things well and some things poorly, but I gave it my all. When a professional gives everything, there‚Äôs a connection that lasts forever. My feeling after these 12 years with the Madrid fans is the same as my own: they respect me and hold me in high esteem. It‚Äôs fantastic for me.‚Äù

‚ÄúI don‚Äôt want to fuel stories that don‚Äôt exist. I have one more year on my contract with Benfica; it‚Äôs special because it‚Äôs an election period and we wanted to protect a new president. It has an easy-to-break clause. I have nothing against Real Madrid. I would love to eliminate Real Madrid, but I would really like Arbeloa to win La Liga and stay at Real Madrid for many years, because he has a lot of talent. He‚Äôs a true Madridista and has a lot of personality.‚Äù

Mourinho‚Äôs time at Real Madrid, despite the love held by some, remains highly controversial too, due to his behaviour on the touchline and in the press room.

‚ÄúI wouldn‚Äôt change anything because I can‚Äôt change anything now. I‚Äôm happy I gave it my all. It doesn‚Äôt matter if you make mistakes, because you gave everything you had. That‚Äôs what I tell my players. If you fail, it‚Äôs okay, you tried everything. I‚Äôm happy with myself.‚Äù

Similarly, he had no regrets about exiting Real Madrid. Mourinho left after four years with a Copa del Rey and a Liga title to show for his efforts in terms of major honours, but they did manage to slow down Pep Guardiola‚Äôs Barcelona.

‚ÄúI must be one of the few Real Madrid coaches to leave without being sacked. When you leave of your own accord, you have nothing to envy. I left with a clean conscience. I‚Äôll never forget what the president told me when I left: ‚ÄòNow comes the easy part, the hard part is over.‚Äô My family is the most important thing to me, and that was the best thing.‚Äù

‚ÄúIt was also the best thing for Real Madrid. After difficult, intense, and turbulent years, everything Real Madrid has done since has only brought me joy. I don‚Äôt feel like I‚Äôm part of anything; the credit belongs to those who were there. The Est√°dio da Luz is a stadium of happiness for Real Madrid. They lost, but they weren‚Äôt eliminated; they won a Champions League title here.‚Äù

Real Madrid will be hoping for revenge over Benfica on Tuesday night at the Estadio da Luz, albeit this time with the second leg in Madrid to fall back on. Kylian Mbappe is set to return to action, but Raul Asencio is missing through suspension. There were positive minutes for Dani Carvajal and Trent Alexander-Arnold, who did not play a part in their first meeting.

title: USA crushes Sweden to reach women's hockey gold medal game
description: Team USA started slow, but attacked in the second period, obliterating Sweden to reach the 2026 Winter Olympics gold medal match Monday in Milan.
fullText:
Feb. 16 (UPI) -- Team USA started slow, but attacked in the second period, obliterating Sweden to reach the 2026 Winter Olympics gold medal match Monday in Milan.

With the 5-0 shutout, the Americans also extended the longest shutout streak in Olympics history to 331:23 of on-action action, including five shutouts. Team USA outshot the Swedes 13-2 through the first 20 minutes of the semifinal, but led just 1-0 to start the second period.

The Americans were outshot 13-11 in the bridge frame, but used four goals -- including three in a stretch of less than three minutes -- to break the game open. Balance was the key in the momentum switch, with five different players scoring in the victory.

"After the first, we came in and thought we have a little bit more to give," forward Taylor Heise, who scored the first goal of the second period, told NBC.

The Americans, who outshot opponents 31-1 through their first six appearances of the 2026 Winter Olympics, will face Canada or Switzerland on Thursday in the gold medal game.

1-0 TO THE USA. CAYLA BARNES FIRES IT IN TO PUT THE AMERICANS ON TOP. pic.twitter.com/gmVwtTpaBD‚Äî NBC Olympics & Paralympics (@NBCOlympics) February 16, 2026

Defenseman Cayla Barnes started the scoring when she beat Swedish goalie Ebba Svensson Traff 5:09 into the semifinal. Kelly Pannek and Lee Stecklein assisted that score.

Abbey Murphy and Hannah Bilka assisted Heise for a 2-0 lead about 11 minutes into the second period. Murphy, Kendall Coyne Schofield and Hayley Scamurra then combined to score three times in 2:47 to break the game open.

THAT is the sound of an early Team USA lead. pic.twitter.com/5UZQ5aLoJp‚Äî NBC Olympics & Paralympics (@NBCOlympics) February 16, 2026

Bilka, who logged two assists, was one of 13 Americans to log a point in the victory. Team USA goalie Aerin Frankel totaled 21 saves.

Canada will meet Switzerland will face off in the second semifinal at 3:10 p.m. EST Monday in Milan. The women's hockey gold medal game will be at 1:10 p.m. EST Thursday at Milano Santagiulia Ice Hockey Arena. The game will air on USA Network.

title: Alabama's AP Poll ranking revealed after wins vs. Ole Miss, Carolina
description: Alabama's AP Poll ranking has been revealed after wins vs. Ole Miss and South Carolina that extended the Tide's winning streak to four-straight.
fullText:
Following yet another impressive week, the Alabama Crimson Tide have officially returned to the AP Poll Top 25.

After falling out entirely two weeks ago, Alabama inched closer to being ranked once again last week, and following another big week on the hardwood, the Crimson Tide have now jumped back into the Top 25. Alabama was ranked as the nation's No. 25 team in the latest AP Poll on Monday.

This past week was one which included two sizable Alabama wins, the first of which came Wednesday night on the road at Ole Miss, 93-74. Alabama followed that up Saturday night with an 89-75 home win over South Carolina, a result which extended the Crimson Tide's current winning streak to four-straight.

Improving to 18-7 overall (8-4 SEC), the Crimson Tide return to action this Wednesday night for a Top 25 showdown against No. 20 Arkansas, with tipoff set for 7 p.m. ET on ESPN. Following that home game, Alabama will then travel Saturday to LSU for a matchup with the unranked Tigers at 6 p.m. ET on SEC Network.

title: Max Muncy Re-Signed With Dodgers Because He‚Äôs ‚ÄòLoyal,‚Äô Wants to Win
description: Los Angeles Dodgers third baseman Max Muncy cited loyalty and his desire to win when asked why he extended with the Dodgers.
fullText:
Los Angeles Dodgers third baseman Max Muncy cited loyalty and his desire to win when asked why he extended with the Dodgers.

The veteran has been with the Dodgers‚Äô organization since 2017, and he has become a two-time All-Star and three-time World Series champion while playing for L.A. He signed a one-year extension for $7 million with a $10 million club option Thursday.

‚ÄúPart of me and who I am as a person and how I was raised, I like to be loyal to people,‚Äù Muncy said. ‚ÄúThis organization took a chance on me when I was out of baseball, basically. That meant a lot to me. They stuck with me when things were going bad. They‚Äôve never wavered on me at all. That means a lot to me in itself, and it‚Äôs just a place I‚Äôm very comfortable. My family‚Äôs comfortable here. We have a chance to win every single year. That‚Äôs why I play this game. I want to win.

‚ÄúObviously, you make money in this game, but that‚Äôs not why I play. I play because I want to win. It‚Äôs the competitive fire that I want to go out and win as much as I can. That to me is worth more than money. I know I‚Äôm leaving money on the table, but I‚Äôm more than OK with that because I wouldn‚Äôt be OK with myself trying to chase money somewhere else, watching this team win and I‚Äôm on the sidelines. That‚Äôs just not who I am. I would rather win.

‚ÄúAnother component to it is just the relationship I‚Äôve built here. Like I was just saying, I like to be loyal and my relationships mean a lot. I‚Äôve created such a relationship with the staff, the front office, the coaches, the medical and training staff, the clubhouse guys. I just don‚Äôt want to create that somewhere else. Being here for my entire career at this point would mean the world to me, and this gives me the chance to do that.‚Äù

Asked Max Muncy about his latest extension, one of many team-friendly deals he has signed w/ the Dodgers since they gave him a second chance after he was released by the A's in 2017.

He knows he left money on the table, but he wouldn't be OK leaving and watching the Dodgers win: pic.twitter.com/hTyQCrCPT6

‚Äî Rowan Kavner (@RowanKavner) February 13, 2026

Muncy is the longest-tenured Dodger after Clayton Kershaw‚Äôs retirement, and is clearly a huge factor for the team if they‚Äôre winning to extend him though the 2028 season.

He had a great season in 2025 before struggling with injury, hitting 19 homers and tallying 67 RBIs through 100 games.

The 35-year-old also played a key role in the postseason, hitting an oft-forgotten homer in Game 7 of the World Series to cut the Toronto Blue Jays‚Äô lead to one run in the bottom of the eighth inning.

The Dodgers clearly want Muncy to stick around, and if he can continue to produce how he has for the last several seasons at the plate, he‚Äôll be an asset to the Dodgers‚Äô title defense and three-peat aspirations.

How do you feel about Max Muncy‚Äôs extension?

title: New No. 1 in Coaches Poll: Duke basketball rises after win vs Clemson
description: Did Clemson drop out of the Coaches Poll after back-to-back losses? Check out where the Tigers rank, and which team is the new No. 1.
fullText:
Coach Brad Brownell's Clemson Tigers have lost back-to-back games in ACC play for the first time this season.

Clemson (20-6 overall, 10-3 conference) fell in a 76-66 upset loss to Virginia Tech at Littlejohn Coliseum on Wednesday. On Saturday, the Duke Blue Devils turned a close game at halftime into a double-digit wallop behind Cameron Boozer and Isaiah Evans in a 67-54 win at Cameron Indoor Stadium.

The Tigers may have entered the week tied with Duke in the ACC standings, but coach Jon Scheyer's Blue Devils left no doubt that the road to the ACC still runs through Durham and Cameron Indoor. Boozer finished with 18 points and Evans had 17 as Duke would lead by as many as 16 in the second half.

Carter Welling led Clemson with 12 points against Duke and RJ Godfrey had 10. Prior to last week, the Tigers had won 13 of 14 games since suffering back-to-back losses to Alabama and BYU in early December.

With only five games remaining on Clemson's 2025-26 regular-season basketball schedule, here's where the Tigers land in this week's USA TODAY Sports Coaches Poll.

Clemson is ranked No. 24 in the Monday's new USA TODAY Sports Coaches Poll entering Week 16 of the 2025-26 college basketball season. The Tigers are ranked one spot below Miami (Ohio), and one spot ahead of the Wisconsin Badgers.

Duke (23-2) remains the ACC's highest-ranked team, moving up three spots to No. 3. The Virginia Cavaliers (22-3, 10-2) jumped past North Carolina (20-5) to become the ACC's second-highest ranked team at No. 14 after the Tar Heels fell in an upset loss to Miami on Tuesday.

UNC fell seven spots to No. 20. The ACC has five teams ranked in the top 25. With Clemson bookending the rankings at No. 24, the Louisville Cardinals (19-6) moved up two spots to No. 21 following their fourth straight win on Saturday against the Ohio State Buckeyes.

For the first time since Jan. 5, there's a new No. 1 in the Coaches Poll. The Michigan Wolverines (24-1) reclaimed the top spot after the Arizona Wildcats (23-2) suffered their first losses of the season to Kansas and Texas Tech, respectively.

Arizona had spent five weeks at No. 1 in the Coaches Poll prior to Monday.

Here's a look at the full Week 16 rankings in the USA TODAY Sports men's basketball coaches poll.

Alabama Crimson Tide 32; Villanova Wildcats 30; Utah State Aggies 20; Tennessee Volunteers 19; Iowa Hawkeyes 7; Kentucky Wildcats 6;¬†Saint Mary's 2; Miami Hurricanes 1.

Clemson will visit Wake Forest (13-12, 4-8) Wednesday night in Winston-Salem. Tipoff for Clemson-Wake Forest is 7 p.m. ET. The game will be televised on ACC Network.

The Tigers then host Florida State at Littlejohn Coliseum on Saturday at noon ET. Clemson-FSU will be televised on The CW.

title: Dodgers Sign Former All-Star Santiago Espinal Amid Tommy Edman Injury Update
description: The Dodgers agreed to sign infielder Santiago Espinal to a minor league deal on Monday after Tommy Edman got a bad injury update.
fullText:
The Los Angeles Dodgers agreed to sign infielder Santiago Espinal to a minor league deal on Monday, adding depth to the team as position players start reporting to Spring Training.

The Dodgers revealed that utility player Tommy Edman will not be ready to go for Opening Day, eliminating an infield piece from the roster outlook.

‚ÄúTommy certainly won‚Äôt be ready for Opening Day,‚Äù manager Dave Roberts said. ‚ÄúHe took some swings a couple days ago, both sides, he did some skipping, some light jogging, I think it was.

‚ÄúGetting his body into baseball shape. Obviously, he‚Äôs not going to be ready for the start of camp and he‚Äôs in that same bucket of ‚Äòwhen he‚Äôs ready he‚Äôs ready.‚Äô Each day there‚Äôs progress.‚Äù

When healthy, Edman is counted on to be the starting second baseman who can fill in all across the field, though especially filling in at center field due to his range and mobility.

With him out of the picture, at least to start the year, the Dodgers signed Santatio Espinal, a six-year veteran who has spent time with the Toronto Blue Jays and Cincinnati Reds, more recently.

Espinal has played second base, third base, shortstop, and the outfield, providing the Dodgers with the same versatility as Edman.

Los Angeles has long valued versatile players under the president of baseball operations, Andrew Friedman, who has added players like Kike Hernandez, Miguel Rojas, and Chris Taylor over the years, keeping them on for multiple years.

Espinal could become the latest addition to become a veteran, versatile mainstay if he can turn things around as a hitter.

Got an update on Tommy Edman. Dave Roberts said he won't be ready for Opening Day:

"He took some swings a couple of days ago. Both sides. He did some skipping. Light jogging. He's not going to be ready for the start of camp. Tommy certainly won't be ready for Opening Day." pic.twitter.com/bpojlp1yFb

‚Äî Doug McKain (@DMAC_LA) February 16, 2026

For the first four years of his career with the Toronto Blue Jays, Espinal was above replacement level, even having two seasons worth 2.4 bWAR. In 2022, he made the All-Star team with Toronto; however, 2023 was a down year for the righty.

The Blue Jays chose to move on from him, dealing the infielder to the Reds for a pitcher. In two years with the Reds, he had -1.8 bWAR, hitting .245/.294/.322. His OPS+ was a measly 68, showing how poor his overall hitting was.

If he can play as he did in 2021 and 2022, Espinal could play a key role with the Dodgers and secure a spot in the postseason platoon, ready to step up in case of an injury.

Dodgers fans should be excited about his arrival, as his steady presence should provide stability until Edman is ready to play.

Edman did not look right for long stretches last season as he dealt with the ankle issue, though Espinal buys him more time to recover and get healthy.

title: NFL Mock Draft Monday: The Sun Devils you might know
description: Who do you want the Eagles to draft?
fullText:
Some of us may have the day off, but mock drafts never do.

After a brief pause in 2024, Howie Roseman got back to trading first-round picks last year. He sticks to that habit by sending a late third- and fourth-round pick to the Vikings so he can snag another big-play machine for an Eagles offense that disappointed in 2025. Tyson dealt with multiple injuries at the college level but could prove to be a steal here, thanks to his ability to win downfield.

In this mock the Eagles trade up to 18 with the Vikings. If something like this were to happen, this would be another ‚Äúhow are teams letting the Eagles do this‚Äù move. Tyson has a lot of love in the draft community. I don‚Äôt quite get the hype, but that‚Äôs just me.

He may not have as much love in the NFL community though, as his injury history is a big concern. He missed time in 2022 and 2023 from a torn ACL, MCL, and PCL. He missed time in 2024 with a broken collarbone. He missed time in 2025 with injuries to both hamstrings.

The Eagles have work to do along the offensive line this offseason, especially with the injury issues that 35-year-old right tackle Lane Johnson had in 2025. Iheanachor had a great week at the Senior Bowl that fortified his status as one of the highest-upside players in this class. He has terrific size at 6-foot-6 and 330 pounds, plus his nifty footwork allows him to hold up in pass protection.

Iheanachor will need time to develop, as he did not play high school football and must refine his technique. (He took nine penalties in 2025, too.) Philly would be an ideal landing spot since he can sit and learn behind a future Hall of Famer for at least a year.

Iheanachor is a risk, but that has never stopped the Eagles.

Iheanachor moved to America from Nigeria when he was 13 and as Yates says, he didn‚Äôt play football in high school, starting his career at East Los Angeles College, a JUCO, transferring after two seasons. He started all 14 Sun Devil games this year, and 5 last year. A team that can have him continuing to bake as a backup makes sense, he‚Äôs got a lot of room to grow. He moves pretty stiff, and he looks like he‚Äôs still figuring things out. I‚Äôd also like to see my big OT play with some nastinesses, which I didn‚Äôt see from him.

The need to develop is to be expected, he wasn‚Äôt playing football five years ago. But new OL coach Chris Kuper has no track record of development, and Lane Johnson has missed time in every season since 2015, so his primary backup is going to see the field.

If AJ Brown moves on this offseason, the Philadelphia Eagles could turn to Washington‚Äôs Denzel Boston to fill the X-receiver role. Boston blends size, skill, and scoring ability into a package tailor-made for the NFL, offering a proven knack for turning targets into explosive plays.

Boston‚Äôs fluidity, tempo management, and zone IQ also give him polished route-running skills, making him a true X-receiver prospect with immediate impact potential. For the Eagles, he offers the kind of contested-catch ability and downfield production that can change the dynamic of the passing game from day one.

We can go ahead and skip the ‚Äúif.‚Äù One reason is that this is a good draft for big WRs, replacing AJ Brown, at least in theory, will be an option in the draft. Along with Boston, Ohio State‚Äôs Carnell Tate‚Äìwho won‚Äôt be on the board when the Eagles currently pick, Jordyn Tyson, Louisville‚Äôs Chris Bell, and Notre Dame‚Äôs Malachi Fields are options too.

Boston does a really good job of using his size as a weapon, but he‚Äôs not just a contested catch merchant, his separation is good too. He might not run the fastest 40 but he can go get the ball down the field. I‚Äôm a fan.

title: Chloe Kim's Famous Beau Sends Her The Valentine We All Wanna Get
description: NFL sack king Myles Garrett appears pretty good at tackling matters of the heart with the Winter Olympics icon.
fullText:
NFL standout Myles Garrett scored major style points for the Valentine‚Äôs Day note he sent his girlfriend, Olympic snowboarder¬†Chloe Kim, on Saturday.

Days earlier, Kim came in second¬†despite hoping to win three straight gold medals in the halfpipe event at the Milan Cortina Games. But, hey, she won silver ‚Äï another medal in an illustrious Winter Olympics career.

Sports: Norwegian Ski Superstar Makes Winter Olympics History With Record-Breaking Gold

Garrett, the Cleveland Browns star who broke the season record for sacks, let his beloved know Saturday she‚Äôs still the GOAT in her sport and in his heart.

‚ÄúSo proud of you!‚Äù he wrote with a photo of a flag-holding Kim celebrating her medal. ‚ÄúI‚Äôm thankful that I get to be by your side watching the extraordinary things you do. You fought through so much to even get to this point and you earned everything and more. The üêê, my love and my Valentine. Happy Valentine‚Äôs Day babe.‚Äù

‚ÄúMy love!! ‚Äù Kim replied. ‚ÄúThank you for dealing with my craziness over the last couple months. Grateful for you, forever my Valentine.‚Äù

Like this article? Keep independent journalism alive. Support HuffPost.

Kim, who dislocated her shoulder¬†before the Games, hinted earlier at what her difficulties were¬†in a detailed Instagram post.

‚ÄúA month ago, I wasn‚Äôt even sure if I‚Äôd be able to compete,‚Äù she wrote. ‚ÄúI was in the darkest space mentally and felt so much fear coming back. To land my run in my first final of the season was the most rewarding and validating thing I‚Äôve ever experienced.‚Äù

Sports: 'Oh My Goodness!': Wild Freestyle Skiing Finish Stuns Fans At Winter Olympics

Kim and Garrett have been one of the power sports couples of these Games. They perhaps don‚Äôt pack the combined social media might of speedskating gold medalist Jutta Leerdam and boxer/influencer Jake Paul.

But they‚Äôre a formidable (and adorable!) pair just the same.

Chloe Kim Settles For Silver, South Korea's Gaon Choi Triumphs In Women's Halfpipe

Chloe Kim Throws Down In Olympic Qualifying Despite Shoulder Scare

title: Browns to hire Mike Rutenberg as defensive coordinator
description: After the resignation of Jim Schwartz, the Browns have found their next defensive coordinator.
fullText:
After the resignation of Jim Schwartz, the Browns have found their next defensive coordinator.

According to multiple reports, the club is hiring Falcons defensive passing game coordinator Mike Rutenberg for the role.

Rutenberg, 44, was set to continue on the Falcons‚Äô staff in 2026 with retained defensive coordinator Jeff Ulbrich after Atlanta hired Kevin Stefanski as head coach. Now Rutenberg will head to Cleveland, where he will work under Stefanski‚Äôs replacement, new head coach Todd Monken.

Rutenberg spent 2013-2019 as a defensive assistant for the Jaguars, serving as assistant linebackers coach for his last two years with the club. He was hired as a passing game specialist for the 49ers in 2020 before heading to the Jets with former head coach Robert Saleh as the club‚Äôs linebackers coach from 2021-2024. He then followed Ulbrich to the Falcons in 2025.

Monken has said he would like the Browns to retain the same scheme that Schwartz ran, given its effectiveness. But with Rutenberg as the hire instead of someone internal, there may be some philosophical shifts to come.

title: Journalist: Liverpool midfielder expected to leave this summer as it stands
description: Curtis Jones Contract Doubts Raise Questions Over Liverpool‚Äôs Midfield FutureUncertainty over Curtis Jones‚Äô future at Liverpool has become a fresh talking point as the midfielder approaches the fi...
fullText:
Uncertainty over Curtis Jones‚Äô future at Liverpool has become a fresh talking point as the midfielder approaches the final year of his contract. With Arne Slot already navigating pressure during a difficult title defence that has left the Reds sixth in the Premier League, the prospect of another unresolved deal adds an extra layer of intrigue to an already complex season.

Speaking to Dave Davis on Anfield Index‚Äôs Media Matters podcast, David Lynch delivered a candid assessment of the situation. He said, ‚ÄúWith Jones, it‚Äôs not great that he has gone down to his last 12 months and the fact that he was open to going in January.‚Äù That admission highlights the delicate balance Liverpool must strike between rewarding a homegrown player and protecting the club‚Äôs long term planning.

Jones has played an important role in recent performances, offering energy and technical quality in midfield. Yet contract uncertainty often shifts the conversation away from form on the pitch and towards long term strategy, something Liverpool have experienced repeatedly over the past year.

Lynch raised an interesting point about wider trends across European football. He explained, ‚ÄúHowever, is this a growing trend in football? To drag your contract to the final year and increase your bargaining power because we‚Äôre seeing it a lot more. Just look at Virgil van Dijk and Mo Salah last year, then Dayot Upamecano at Bayern Munich more recently.‚Äù

The modern football landscape has changed dramatically, with players and agents increasingly aware of the leverage created by shorter contract timelines. For Liverpool, who have traditionally preferred to secure extensions well before deals enter their final stages, this shift represents a new challenge.

Jones‚Äô situation feels particularly significant because he represents the academy pathway that supporters value deeply. Losing a local talent, especially during a period when Slot is trying to reshape the squad‚Äôs identity, would carry emotional as well as tactical consequences.

External interest has only intensified the discussion. Clubs such as Inter Milan and Tottenham Hotspur are reportedly monitoring the midfielder, which naturally strengthens the player‚Äôs negotiating position. Liverpool‚Äôs hierarchy must now decide whether to accelerate talks or risk entering next season with a key asset approaching free agency.

Lynch‚Äôs outlook remains cautious, stating, ‚ÄúI hope it is just that but the other signs around it aren‚Äôt great and if you were to ask me what is going to happen, I‚Äôm not massively encouraged that he is going to be here next season.‚Äù That perspective reflects a growing sense that Liverpool may face difficult decisions in the months ahead.

From a tactical viewpoint, Jones offers versatility that suits Slot‚Äôs evolving system. As Liverpool continue their Champions League campaign and pursue FA Cup success, maintaining squad depth will be crucial. The Brighton victory recently offered a glimpse of renewed cohesion, yet long term planning continues behind the scenes.

Contract negotiations often reveal as much about a club‚Äôs strategy as they do about individual players. Liverpool are in a transitional phase following last season‚Äôs title triumph, balancing immediate results with the need to build a sustainable future. Jones‚Äô decision could become a symbol of how the next phase of Slot‚Äôs project unfolds.

Supporters may hope that discussions lead to clarity sooner rather than later, particularly as performances have begun to show signs of improvement. For now, the situation remains unresolved, shaped by market trends, player ambition and the club‚Äôs wider ambitions.

Whatever happens next, Lynch‚Äôs comments underline the uncertainty that surrounds Liverpool‚Äôs midfield planning. As the season progresses, the Jones contract story may prove as influential off the pitch as any result achieved on it.

title: Arizona men‚Äôs basketball falls in AP poll following back-to-back losses
description: Arizona men‚Äôs basketball‚Äôs reign atop the Associated Press poll ended Monday after the Wildcats dropped a pair of games last week. Arizona (23-2) fell to No. 4 in this week‚Äôs rankings, an expected tumble after losing on the road to Kansas and at home to Texas Tech. Arizona led the AP poll for nine straight [‚Ä¶]
fullText:
Arizona men‚Äôs basketball‚Äôs reign atop the Associated Press poll ended Monday after the Wildcats dropped a pair of games last week.

Arizona (23-2) fell to No. 4 in this week‚Äôs rankings, an expected tumble after losing on the road to Kansas and at home to Texas Tech. Arizona led the AP poll for nine straight weeks, the longest streak in program history.

Michigan leads the rankings, followed by No. 2 Houston and No. 3 Duke. Arizona is ranked above No. 5 UConn, who the Wildcats beat in a top-five matchup in November.

Now comes another top-five matchup Saturday against the second-ranked Cougars. First Arizona must get by No. 23 BYU, which just lost senior Richie Saunders for the year due to a torn ACL.

Other Big 12 teams ranked this week are No. 6 Iowa State, No. 8 Kansas, and No. 13 Texas Tech.

Arizona still has to host Iowa State and Kansas.

The UA is currently No. 3 in the NCAA NET Rankings. Arizona has nine Quad 1 wins, tied with Michigan for second-most in the country and trailing only Duke.

title: The Good, The Bad, and The Ugly: 2026 MLS Kits
description: With the 2026 MLS kits officially released, we rank them in our latest installment of The Good, The Bad, and The Ugly.¬†It‚Äôs that time of year when MLS clubs and adidas reveal a whole range of new k...
fullText:
With the 2026 MLS kits officially released, we rank them in our latest installment of The Good, The Bad, and The Ugly.

It‚Äôs that time of year when MLS clubs and adidas reveal a whole range of new kits, and that means we get to eat. I‚Äôve sifted through them all, analyzing them for the latest edition of our The Good, The Bad, and The Ugly series. From beauties like Inter Miami to downright disgraces like Nashville, let‚Äôs tuck in and review them all.

Inspired by the 1996 Olympics medal design, this Atlanta United kit is fantastic. An off-white base color complemented by gold detailing and a beautiful green stripe down the side is a top notch design that doesn‚Äôt try too hard.

The Carolina blue on this shirt is loud, loud enough for me to sit up and listen. The crown pattern used on the neckline trim and sleeve cuffs really elevates the shirt. I love it.

Traditional, yet effective. I tossed and turned over adding this to the good section due to the white section across the middle, and I settled on the fact that the classic collar saves it. A nice shade of red that pays tribute to the Chicago Fire‚Äôs history. I‚Äôm in.

Black shirt? Good start. Add a multi-colored collar and sleeve cuffs to jazz thing up bit and you‚Äôre starting to speak a bit of my language. Simple base design, elevated with some exciting details. This one is good.

I‚Äôd say this is top two from the whole collection. Black and yellow is a good combination, especially when you mix it with such a classic collar and sleeve trim. Beautiful stuff. Identity, reinforced.

This is a big yes. All black base with hints of red. That‚Äôs it. Sorted.

It‚Äôs a bit of a cheat code to have your base colors as pink and black, just ask Palermo. There‚Äôs a reason they‚Äôre such a cult hero. Inter Miami have reversed this colorway for this kit, and it‚Äôs working. A button-up collar, too? Mamma Mia-mi.

It‚Äôs a bit of James Bond and a bit of Jay Gatsby all rolled into one for a team right out of the city that never sleeps. A team from the Big Apple deserves the finest, and this is it. Brilliant.

Venture across the city, and you get the New York Red Bulls. People aren‚Äôt typically a fan of Red Bull-owned clubs, but I won‚Äôt open that can of worms. My placement of this kit in the good section might be biased, because it gives me a mix of Stranger Things and Mount Vesuvius, which happen to be two of my favorite things.

Purple and yellow shouldn‚Äôt work. But on this shirt, I am having it. Maybe I‚Äôm just feeling a bit jazzy today. Yes.

A kit with a pattern of the Declaration of Independence with imagery of the Founding Fathers? If you‚Äôre going to do a kit for an American team, then this is how you do it.

Unlike FC Dallas‚Äô shirt, which we‚Äôll get to momentarily, this is a properly done blue and red hooped shirt.

Oh, yes. The colors on this shirt are beautiful and the neck and sleeve trims are just delightful. A top, top shirt.

This is the type of kit that‚Äôd make a bit of noise because it‚Äôs somewhat different. However, it misses the mark. While it‚Äôs not entirely ugly, it looks like it should be used as a wrapper for some form of spearmint-based candy. I don‚Äôt like it. And I‚Äôm always right.

For some reason, this shirt does not work for me at all. The sublimated pattern across the shirt is terrible, and it looks like some knock off you‚Äôd see being hawked in a stall at a Fourth of July parade. All that said, it‚Äôs not a total disaster, and I can definitely see people liking this iteration of a tried-and-true football shirt design.

The idea isn‚Äôt bad. Gold and black are a strong combination. However, this execution doesn‚Äôt quite hit the mark. The Art Deco pattern doesn‚Äôt hit for me, and it seems like a missed opportunity when you have two incredibly strong colors.

It‚Äôs classic LA Galaxy, but that‚Äôs it. The sash, though, is not hitting the vibe at all. The random glitch in the middle of it is the main culprit. Overall, it just feels a bit stale.

If they didn‚Äôt have the sash caused by the pattern ending, then this shirt would be decent. A design choice that screams ‚ÄúI am trying so hard to be different,‚Äù but misses the mark entirely when doing so. Overdoing it.

What in the comic book fight scene is this?!

Tie-dye? In the big 2026? I get that they‚Äôre paying tribute to the Grateful Dead, but there‚Äôs better ways to do so. See: Nike SB.

If this didn‚Äôt have the weird material effect on it, it‚Äôd look less like a curtain on a terrible award show stage and instead, it‚Äôd be a decent kit.

This feels medieval. Do you get what I mean?

The only thing good about this kit is the collar trim and sleeve trim, but they‚Äôre not powerful enough to overcome the geometric pattern. A terrible shirt. A pattern like this on a football shirt can be difficult to get right, and this one is certainly far from the mark. Blech.

I can‚Äôt believe this got signed off by professionals. It‚Äôs terrible. I can‚Äôt quite put my finger on it, but it looks like it belongs in a rogue knock-off arcade game. The diamonds pattern offends me every single time I look at it.

Not for me, at all. I respect it for being so bold, but I don‚Äôt like it at all. The abstract pattern would work better if they didn‚Äôt split it into stripes, to be honest. I‚Äôll take my payment for the design consultancy via bank transfer, please.

Whatever Columbus Crew can do, we can do 10x worse. Nah.

This colourway is called ‚ÄúIce Yellow.‚Äù More like ‚ÄúNot Very Nice Yellow.‚Äù Am I right?

title: Browns reportedly hire Falcons defensive pass game coordinator Mike Rutenberg to replace Jim Schwartz as DC
description: Rutenberg will be a first-time defensive coordinator.
fullText:
The Cleveland Browns will reportedly hire Falcons defensive pass game coordinator Mike Rutenberg as defensive coordinator, according to ESPN's Jeremy Fowler. The Browns hired Rutenberg over Browns linebackers coach Jason Tarver and Houston Texans defensive passing game coordinator Cory Undlin.

Rutenberg will replace former Browns defensive coordinator Jim Schwartz, who resigned after getting passed over for the team's head coaching vacancy.

This story will continue to be updated.

title: Olympic Medal Count: Who is bringing home the gold from the U.S. and Washington state?
description: Western Washington University alum Breezy Johnson took home Team USA‚Äôs first medal of the 2026 Milan Cortina Olympic Games, earning a gold medal in women‚Äôs downhill skiing.
fullText:
Last updated: 10 a.m. PST, Monday, February 16, 2026

The USA currently has 17 medals, and two of them were brought in by Washington-associated athletes.

As of Monday morning, here‚Äôs which medals Team USA holds:

Alpine Skiing: 1 gold, 1 silver, 1 bronze

Cross-Country Skiing: 1 silver, 1 bronze

Figure Skating: 1 gold, 1 silver

Freestyle Skiing: 1 gold, 3 silver, 1 bronze

Western Washington University alum Breezy Johnson took home Team USA‚Äôs first medal of the 2026 Milan Cortina Olympic Games, earning a gold medal in Women‚Äôs Downhill with a time of 1 minute and 36.10 seconds.

A few days later, Johnson lost out on the podium to Jackie Wiles and her teammate Paula Moltzan, who together earned their bronze medals in Alpine Skiing Women‚Äôs Team Combined. While she originally hails from Portland, Oregon, U.S. Ski and Snowboard calls Wiles ‚Äúa product entirely of the Pacific Northwest Ski Association.‚Äù

Eunice Lee - Short Track Speed Skating

Erin Martin - Para Nordic Skiing

Novie McCabe - Cross-Country Skiing

Corinne Stoddard - Short Track Speed Skating

Anna Gibson, a former University of Washington runner and member of the Seattle-based Brooks Beasts running team, is making her Winter Olympics debut in the inaugural Ski Mountaineering race.

The U.S. Olympic Women‚Äôs Ice Hockey Team, which includes four Seattle Torrent players, kicked off the 2026 Olympic Games with a 5-1 win over Czechia.

The Torrent‚Äôs Hilary Knight was named captain of the team, with Torrent forward Alex Carpenter joining the leadership team as one of two alternate captains. Torrent forward Hannah Bilka and defender Cayla Barnes are also on the roster.

Torrent defender Aneta Tejralov√° is playing for Team Czechia.

Knight tied the record for the most career Olympic goals (14) in U.S. women‚Äôs ice hockey history last weekend. The five-time Olympian, who has announced the 2026 Winter Olympics will be her last, is now tied with Hockey Hall of Fame inductees Katie King and Natalie Darwitz for most Olympic goals in U.S. Women‚Äôs Olympic history.

Here‚Äôs Team USA‚Äôs scores so far:

USA 6 - Italy 0 (Quarterfinals)

Canada is set to play Switzerland on Monday, with the winning team advancing to play Team USA in the Women‚Äôs Gold Medal Game on Thursday.

Kraken goaltender Philipp Grubauer is competing for Team Germany, while right-wingers Eeli Tolvanen and Kaapo Kakko are playing for Team Finland. Seattle Kraken forward Oscar Fisker Molgaard is playing for Team Denmark.

Find more scores and details about each player at olympics.com
